abstract: Potential borrowers hoping for government-backed small-business loans are waiting on House vote that would allow Small Business Admin to continue lending beyond 2015 limit of $18.75 billion, which it has already reached; over 900 applicants are waiting for loan approvals; fact that cap was reached so early in year underscores demand.
lead_paragraph: When the Small Business Administration’s largest lending program hit its 2015 limit of $18.75 billion in loan guarantees last week, more than 900 applicants were waiting for their loans to be approved.

headline.main: Small Businesses Await House Action on Frozen Loan Program
headline.print_headline: Loans on Ice, S.B.A. Waits for Action From House

snippet: When the Small Business Administration’s largest lending program hit its 2015 limit of $18.75 billion in loan guarantees last week, more than 900 applicants were waiting for their loans to be approved.
